Package org.apache.logging.log4j.kit.env

Interface PropertyEnvironment

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicPropertyEnvironment, ClassLoaderPropertyEnvironment, CompositePropertyEnvironment, PropertiesUtilPropertyEnvironment
public interface PropertyEnvironment
Represents the main access point to Log4j properties.

It provides as typesafe way to access properties stored in multiple PropertySources, type conversion methods and property aggregation methods (cf. getProperty(Class)).

    • getProperty

      @Nullable String getProperty(String name)
      Gets the named property as a String.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the property to look up
      Returns:
      the String value of the property or null if undefined.

    • getProperty

      <T> T getProperty(Class<T> propertyClass)
      Binds properties to class T.

      The implementation should at least support binding Java records with a single public constructor and enums.

      Parameters:
      propertyClass - a class annotated by Log4jProperty.
      Returns:
      an instance of T with all JavaBean properties bound.
